result.execSummary:
The defendant Nathan R Bodensteiner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Costs shall be paid as the condition of probation in 15CM1102.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample.

With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nathan R Bodensteiner

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

Washington County Sheriff's Department Jail Disposition of Prisoners
Washington County Sheriff's Department Jail Disposition of Prisoners

Def in person & by Atty Michael F. Bishop.  Atty Mandy A. Schepper appeared for State.  Clerk: EZ.  (15CM1102 Br. 2)  Guilty plea entered to Count 1,  Court dismissed Count 2 for read-in.  Court finds def guilty on Count 1 and enters judgment.  Counsel argues for sentence credit for time served sentence on this case so defendant can go inpatient tomorrow.  State opposes request as violates plea negotiations.  Counsel request case be passed to further aruge.  Court maintains sentence.
Victim does not request to be present for hearings
Def in person & by Atty Michael F. Bishop.  Atty Peter John Cannon appeared for State.  Clerk: EZ.   Counsel's first appearance.  Plea hearing scheduled for November 18, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
Take all medications as prescribed; no violent contact with R.B. or M.B.

Def appears in custody & w/Atty Michael F. Bishop by telephone.  Atty Mark D. Bensen for State.  Clerk: EZ.   Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found. Court orders $250.00 signature bond.  Court discloses if familiar with the defendant's father but will not recuse on this case.  Hearing scheduled for October 7, 2015 at 09:45 am.
